metas.name: Prisoners
metas.description: Given your appreciation for intense thrillers with dark themes like 'Sicario' and 'Gone Girl,' 'Prisoners' offers a deeply unsettling and morally complex exploration of desperation and vengeance. Its high stakes and psychological depth will undoubtedly engage you.

metas.name: No Country for Old Men
metas.description: Echoing the gritty crime and suspense of 'Sicario' and 'Lucky Number Slevin,' this Coen Brothers masterpiece features a relentless antagonist and a palpable sense of dread, making for a truly gripping viewing experience.

metas.name: The Lighthouse
metas.description: Your enjoyment of 'The Master' suggests an interest in character-driven dramas with psychological intensity. 'The Lighthouse' is a visually striking and thematically dense film that delves into madness and isolation with a dark, almost horror-like atmosphere.

metas.name: Memories of Murder
metas.description: As a fan of crime thrillers like 'Gone Girl' and 'Lucky Number Slevin,' this South Korean masterpiece offers a masterful blend of procedural investigation, dark humor, and profound social commentary on a real-life serial killer case.

metas.name: Hereditary
metas.description: For fans of genuinely disturbing horror like 'The Conjuring 2' and '28 Days Later,' 'Hereditary' delivers a gut-wrenching and psychologically taxing experience that transcends typical genre scares with its profound exploration of grief and familial trauma.

metas.name: Drive
metas.description: Your taste for stylish, tense crime dramas like 'Sicario' and 'In Bruges' will find a strong match in 'Drive.' It's a neo-noir thriller with a cool aesthetic, a brooding protagonist, and bursts of brutal violence.

metas.name: A Separation
metas.description: Drawing parallels to the emotional complexity and dramatic weight of 'The Master,' this Iranian film is a masterclass in nuanced storytelling, dissecting a marriage's breakdown and the societal pressures that accompany it with stark realism.

metas.name: Zodiac
metas.description: If you enjoyed the procedural and obsessive nature of 'Gone Girl' and 'Seven Psychopaths' (for its crime elements), 'Zodiac' is a meticulously crafted thriller about the real-life hunt for a notorious serial killer, prioritizing atmosphere and detail.

metas.name: Burning
metas.description: This South Korean psychological thriller, much like 'Gone Girl,' thrives on ambiguity and simmering tension, creating an unsettling atmosphere that questions perception and class dynamics.

metas.name: Mother!
metas.description: For viewers who appreciate challenging and thematically rich cinema like 'The Master' and dark comedic elements reminiscent of 'Parasite' (though this is a full-on thriller/horror), 'Mother!' is a powerful, allegorical, and intensely unsettling experience.

metas.name: Mulholland Drive
metas.description: Given your interest in psychological mysteries and challenging narratives ('Gone Girl,' 'Bugonia'), David Lynch's surreal masterpiece offers a dreamlike, disorienting exploration of Hollywood, identity, and desire.

metas.name: Blue Ruin
metas.description: This is a stark, character-driven revenge thriller that shares the grounded grit of 'Sicario' and the thematic weight of 'The Shawshank Redemption' (in its exploration of consequence and justice, albeit from a different angle).

metas.name: The Wailing
metas.description: If you enjoyed the supernatural dread of 'The Conjuring 2' and the unsettling mystery of 'It's What's Inside,' this South Korean horror film is a complex, atmospheric, and deeply disturbing descent into paranoia and folk horror.

metas.name: Killing of a Sacred Deer
metas.description: Your appreciation for dark, unsettling themes and psychological tension (e.g., 'Gone Girl,' 'The Master') will be met by this unsettling Yorgos Lanthimos film. It's a modern-day Greek tragedy with a chillingly detached tone.

metas.name: The Gift
metas.description: This psychological thriller offers a slow-burn tension and exploration of past grievances, similar to the intricate plotting of 'Gone Girl' and the character-driven drama of 'The Master.'

metas.name: Under the Skin
metas.description: For a thought-provoking and unsettling sci-fi experience that shares thematic depth with 'Bugonia' and 'It's What's Inside' (but with a much darker, more experimental tone), this film is a must-see.

metas.name: Shame
metas.description: If you appreciated the raw emotional complexity and dark themes explored in 'The Master,' 'Shame' delves deeply into addiction and isolation with unflinching honesty and a powerful performance.

metas.name: You Were Never Really Here
metas.description: This gritty, neo-noir thriller, much like 'Sicario,' features a protagonist grappling with past trauma and engaging in brutal acts. It's lean, intense, and character-focused.

metas.name: It Follows
metas.description: A modern horror classic that prioritizes atmosphere and a unique premise over jump scares, much like the intelligent horror elements you might have enjoyed in '28 Days Later' or 'The Conjuring 2.'

metas.name: Dogtooth
metas.description: For viewers who appreciate challenging, dark, and often disturbing narratives like 'The Master' and 'Bugonia' (for its unusual premise), this Yorgos Lanthimos film is an extreme exploration of control and familial dysfunction.

metas.name: Good Time
metas.description: This high-octane crime thriller, similar to the relentless nature of 'Sicario' and the desperation in 'Gone Girl,' throws you into a chaotic night in New York City with a palpable sense of urgency.

metas.name: The Babadook
metas.description: This Australian horror film masterfully blends genuine scares with a profound exploration of grief and depression, appealing to those who appreciate the emotional complexity found in 'The Master' and the horror elements of 'The Conjuring 2.'

metas.name: The Neon Demon
metas.description: If you enjoyed the darker, more unsettling aspects of your watched films and appreciate stylish, thematic depth (like 'The Master'), this visually stunning thriller delves into the dark side of the fashion industry.

metas.name: The Guard
metas.description: This dark comedy crime film, much like 'In Bruges' and 'Seven Psychopaths,' offers a unique blend of dry wit, gritty realism, and unexpected turns in a lawless Irish setting.

metas.name: A Clockwork Orange
metas.description: Given your appreciation for challenging, dark, and thematically rich cinema like 'The Master' and 'Inglourious Basterds,' this dystopian classic is a powerful, controversial, and thought-provoking exploration of free will and societal control.

metas.name: Under the Silver Lake
metas.description: For fans of enigmatic mysteries with a Lynchian feel, like 'Mulholland Drive,' this film offers a sprawling, surreal conspiracy thriller set in Los Angeles, full of hidden meanings and dark humor.

metas.name: Calibre
metas.description: This Scottish thriller delivers intense suspense and moral ambiguity, similar to the high stakes and desperate situations in 'Sicario' and 'Gone Girl,' but in a more contained, survivalist setting.

metas.name: The Killing of a Chinese Bookie
metas.description: Fans of the complex character studies and dark underbelly explored in films like 'The Master' and 'Lucky Number Slevin' will find a character-driven crime drama that is both melancholic and intense.

metas.name: Mandy
metas.description: This visually striking and surreal revenge film offers a unique blend of intense violence and psychedelic horror, appealing to those who appreciate the darker, more experimental side of cinema like 'Bugonia' or 'It's What's Inside.'

metas.name: The Guest
metas.description: A genre-bending thriller with dark comedic undertones and suspense, akin to the stylish crime elements of 'Lucky Number Slevin' and the unpredictable nature of 'In Bruges.'

metas.name: Black Swan
metas.description: This psychological thriller dives deep into obsession and madness, offering an intense character study that parallels the thematic depth of 'The Master' and the suspense of 'Gone Girl.'

metas.name: The Strangers
metas.description: If you enjoyed the relentless terror of 'The Conjuring 2' and the suspense of '28 Weeks Later,' this home invasion horror film is known for its chilling atmosphere and grounded sense of dread.

metas.name: Oldboy
metas.description: This South Korean masterpiece is a visceral and shocking revenge thriller with profound twists, much like the intricate plotting and dark themes found in 'Gone Girl' and 'Sicario.'

metas.name: Tusk
metas.description: For those who enjoy the darker, more disturbing, and even absurd elements that can surface in a thriller or horror, this Kevin Smith film offers a truly bizarre and unsettling premise with a touch of dark comedy.

metas.name: The Machinist
metas.description: This psychological thriller delves into guilt, paranoia, and mental breakdown, providing an intense and disorienting experience for those who appreciated the complex character study of 'The Master' and the mystery of 'Gone Girl.'

metas.name: Blue Velvet
metas.description: Given your interest in dark themes and psychological depth, this David Lynch film uncovers a sinister underbelly beneath suburban normalcy, offering a surreal and unsettling mystery that echoes elements of 'Mulholland Drive.'

metas.name: The Devils
metas.description: A highly controversial and thematically dense historical horror film that explores religious fanaticism and societal corruption. For viewers who appreciate challenging and provocative cinema like 'Inglourious Basterds' and 'The Master,' this is a powerful experience.

metas.name: Enter the Void
metas.description: This experimental film offers a visually stunning and deeply immersive, albeit challenging, journey through life, death, and the afterlife. It's for those who appreciate highly artistic and thought-provoking cinema, similar to the unique feel of 'Bugonia' or 'It's What's Inside' but with a much darker, more existential tone.

metas.name: A Serbian Film
metas.description: Considered one of the most disturbing films ever made, this is for viewers who actively seek out extreme and challenging content. Its dark themes and intensity are unparalleled, and while polarizing, it certainly demands attention.
